info.title: MyHordes External API
info.description: This documentation describes the MyHordes external API. There are two APIs available to use - JSON and XML. Although it's possible to mix them, this is not recommended.

tags.name: JSON API
tags.description: Implements the newer Twinoid JSON API

get.summary: Returns a list of available endpoints

parameters.name: header_only
parameters.description: Set true to only fetch the header node. Speeds up response time immensely.

parameters.name: cache
parameters.description: Set true to allow the data node to be rendered from a cache. Speeds up response time.

get.summary: Information about multiple users at once.
Get a list of town IDs for a specific season. NOTE: This endpoint is NOT AVAILABLE when using demo keys.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description: Season. Defaults to current season. Use 'a' to select the MyHordes alpha Season and 'b' to select the MyHordes beta season, otherwise enter a season number.

JSONParameterFields.name: fields
JSONParameterFields.description: Comma-separated list of fields to fetch for the result set. Check the example below for a list of valid fields.

JSONParameterFilter.name: filters
JSONParameterFilter.description: Reduce the output list to the given UIDs. Multiple values can be separated by commas.

JSONParameterLanguage.name: languages
JSONParameterLanguage.description: Comma-separated list of languages to fetch the content in. Note that passing only a single language will turn all language-dependant fields to a single string.

secret_key.name: appkey
secret_key.description: Application key. You can obtain this key by contacting the Technical Support. For testing purposes, you may use the following key: fefe0000fefe0000fefe0000fefe0000. This key is only valid in combination with a test user key.

user_key.name: userkey
user_key.description: User key. This key is transmitted to your application when users visit it over the Application Directory. For testing purposes, you may use the following key: fefe0000fefe0000fefe0000fefe0000. This key is only valid when you're actively logged into MyHordes and will resolve to your own user account. Together with the secret test key, it can be used to test the API without the need of registering for a secret key.
